[{"type": "dataset", "id": "ca.cioos_d3d5f1fa-a4d7-40aa-b564-11edc5d78d25", "author": [{"given": "Meaghan C.", "family": "Bartley"}, {"given": "Tommy", "family": "Tremblay"}, {"given": "Amila O.", "family": "De Silva"}, {"given": "C. Michelle", "family": "Kamula"}, {"given": "Stephen", "family": "Ciastek"}, {"given": "Zou Zou", "family": "Kuzyk"}], "issued": [{"date-parts": ["2023", "10", "18"]}], "abstract": "Ce jeu de données comprend des données géochimiques et des données sur les contaminants mesurées dans les sédiments de surface et dans des sections de carottes de sédiments recueillies dans le bras de mer Koojesse et à d'autres endroits de la baie Frobisher, au Nunavut. Des carottes de sédiments et des sédiments de surface ont été prélevés dans l'inlet Koojesse en 2017 par le Bureau géoscientifique Canada-Nunavut à bord du navire MV Nuliajuk. Des carottes de sédiments ont été collectées à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur de la baie Frobisher en 2018 par des chercheurs de l'Université du Manitoba à bord du brise-glace Amundsen du CCGS.

Les paramètres géochimiques mesurés dans les échantillons de carottes de sédiments comprenaient les radio-isotopes (210Pb et 137Cs), la teneur en carbone et en azote et les isotopes stables (δ13C et δ15N). Les contaminants mesurés dans certaines sections de sédiments comprenaient le mercure total (ThG), les principaux éléments et les oligo-éléments, les polychlorobiphényles (PCB), les hydrocarbures aromatiques polycycliques (HAP) et les substances per et polyfluoroalkyles (PFAS).

Un autre jeu de données associé à ce même projet est disponible pour les données sur les contaminants collectées sur les palourdes (Mya truncata) dans la même zone en 2018-2019 :

- **Analyses des apports de contaminants effectuées sur des palourdes dans la baie de Frobisher, Nunavut (2017-2018)** (à venir)

Pour information supplémentaire, veuillez consulter l’article suivant : [**Meaghan C. Bartley, Tommy Tremblay, Amila O. De Silva, C. Michelle Kamula, Stephen Ciastek, Zou Zou A. Kuzyk. 2023. Sedimentary records of contaminant inputs in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut. Environmental Science and Ecotechnology, 100313**](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ese.2023.100313).

Ce projet fait partie du Programme sur les données environnementales côtières de référence de Pêches et Océan Canada.", "edition": "", "edition-date": "", "publisher": "", "title": "Registres sédimentaires des apports de contaminants dans la baie de Frobisher, Nunavut (2017-2018)", "DOI": "10.26071/ogsl-d3d5f1fa-a4d7", "language": "fr", "URL": "https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/dataset/ca-cioos_d3d5f1fa-a4d7-40aa-b564-11edc5d78d25?local=fr"}]

[{"type": "dataset", "id": "ca.cioos_d3d5f1fa-a4d7-40aa-b564-11edc5d78d25", "author": [{"given": "Meaghan C.", "family": "Bartley"}, {"given": "Tommy", "family": "Tremblay"}, {"given": "Amila O.", "family": "De Silva"}, {"given": "C. Michelle", "family": "Kamula"}, {"given": "Stephen", "family": "Ciastek"}, {"given": "Zou Zou", "family": "Kuzyk"}], "issued": [{"date-parts": ["2023", "10", "18"]}], "abstract": "This dataset includes geochemical and contaminant data measured in surface sediments and sections of sediment cores collected from Koojesse Inlet and other locations in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut. Sediment cores and surface sediment were collected throughout Koojesse Inlet in 2017 by the Canada-Nunavut Geoscience Office aboard MV Nuliajuk vessel. Sediment cores were collected from inner and outer Frobisher Bay in 2018 by University of Manitoba researchers onboard the CCGS Amundsen icebreaker.

Geochemical parameters measured in sediment core samples included radioisotopes (210Pb and 137Cs), carbon and nitrogen content, and stable isotopes (δ13C and δ15N). Contaminants measured in selected sediment sections included total mercury (THg), major and trace elements, polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs), polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs), and per and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFASs).

Another dataset associated with this same project is available for contaminant data collected on clams (Mya truncata) from the same area in 2018-2019:

- **Analyses of contaminant inputs conducted on clams in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut (2017-2018)** (upcoming)

For further information, please consult the following paper: [**Meaghan C. Bartley, Tommy Tremblay, Amila O. De Silva, C. Michelle Kamula, Stephen Ciastek, Zou Zou A. Kuzyk. 2023. Sedimentary records of contaminant inputs in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut. Environmental Science and Ecotechnology, 100313**](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ese.2023.100313).

This project is part of the Coastal Environmental Baseline Program under the Oceans Protection Plan of Fisheries and Oceans Canada.", "edition": "", "edition-date": "", "publisher": "", "title": "Sedimentary Records of Contaminant Inputs in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut (2017-2018)", "DOI": "10.26071/ogsl-d3d5f1fa-a4d7", "language": "en", "URL": "https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/dataset/ca-cioos_d3d5f1fa-a4d7-40aa-b564-11edc5d78d25?local=en"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>This dataset includes geochemical and contaminant data measured in surface sediments and sections of sediment cores collected from Koojesse Inlet and other locations in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut. Sediment cores and surface sediment were collected throughout Koojesse Inlet in 2017 by the Canada-Nunavut Geoscience Office aboard MV Nuliajuk vessel. Sediment cores were collected from inner and outer Frobisher Bay in 2018 by University of Manitoba researchers onboard the CCGS Amundsen icebreaker.

Geochemical parameters measured in sediment core samples included radioisotopes (210Pb and 137Cs), carbon and nitrogen content, and stable isotopes (Œ¥13C and Œ¥15N). Contaminants measured in selected sediment sections included total mercury (THg), major and trace elements, polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs), polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs), and per and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFASs).

Another dataset associated with this same project is available for contaminant data collected on clams (Mya truncata) from the same area in 2018-2019:

- **Analyses of contaminant inputs conducted on clams in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut (2017-2018)** (upcoming)

For further information, please consult the following paper: [**Meaghan C. Bartley, Tommy Tremblay, Amila O. De Silva, C. Michelle Kamula, Stephen Ciastek, Zou Zou A. Kuzyk. 2023. Sedimentary records of contaminant inputs in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut. Environmental Science and Ecotechnology, 100313**](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ese.2023.100313).

This project is part of the Coastal Environmental Baseline Program under the Oceans Protection Plan of Fisheries and Oceans Canada.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="#fr">Ce jeu de donn√©es comprend des donn√©es g√©ochimiques et des donn√©es sur les contaminants mesur√©es dans les s√©diments de surface et dans des sections de carottes de s√©diments recueillies dans le bras de mer Koojesse et √† d'autres endroits de la baie Frobisher, au Nunavut. Des carottes de s√©diments et des s√©diments de surface ont √©t√© pr√©lev√©s dans l'inlet Koojesse en 2017 par le Bureau g√©oscientifique Canada-Nunavut √† bord du navire MV Nuliajuk. Des carottes de s√©diments ont √©t√© collect√©es √† l'int√©rieur et √† l'ext√©rieur de la baie Frobisher en 2018 par des chercheurs de l'Universit√© du Manitoba √† bord du brise-glace Amundsen du CCGS.

Les param√®tres g√©ochimiques mesur√©s dans les √©chantillons de carottes de s√©diments comprenaient les radio-isotopes (210Pb et 137Cs), la teneur en carbone et en azote et les isotopes stables (Œ¥13C et Œ¥15N). Les contaminants mesur√©s dans certaines sections de s√©diments comprenaient le mercure total (ThG), les principaux √©l√©ments et les oligo-√©l√©ments, les polychlorobiph√©nyles (PCB), les hydrocarbures aromatiques polycycliques (HAP) et les substances per et polyfluoroalkyles (PFAS).

Un autre jeu de donn√©es associ√© √† ce m√™me projet est disponible pour les donn√©es sur les contaminants collect√©es sur les palourdes (Mya truncata) dans la m√™me zone en 2018-2019¬†:

- **Analyses des apports de contaminants effectu√©es sur des palourdes dans la baie de Frobisher, Nunavut (2017-2018)** (√† venir)

Pour information suppl√©mentaire, veuillez consulter l‚Äôarticle suivant : [**Meaghan C. Bartley, Tommy Tremblay, Amila O. De Silva, C. Michelle Kamula, Stephen Ciastek, Zou Zou A. Kuzyk. 2023. Sedimentary records of contaminant inputs in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut. Environmental Science and Ecotechnology, 100313**](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ese.2023.100313).

Ce projet fait partie du Programme sur les donn√©es environnementales c√¥ti√®res de r√©f√©rence de P√™ches et Oc√©an Canada.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>

name: ca-cioos_d3d5f1fa-a4d7-40aa-b564-11edc5d78d25
notes:
This dataset includes geochemical and contaminant data measured in surface sediments and sections of sediment cores collected from Koojesse Inlet and other locations in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut. Sediment cores and surface sediment were collected throughout Koojesse Inlet in 2017 by the Canada-Nunavut Geoscience Office aboard MV Nuliajuk vessel. Sediment cores were collected from inner and outer Frobisher Bay in 2018 by University of Manitoba researchers onboard the CCGS Amundsen icebreaker.

Geochemical parameters measured in sediment core samples included radioisotopes (210Pb and 137Cs), carbon and nitrogen content, and stable isotopes (Œ¥13C and Œ¥15N). Contaminants measured in selected sediment sections included total mercury (THg), major and trace elements, polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs), polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs), and per and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFASs).

Another dataset associated with this same project is available for contaminant data collected on clams (Mya truncata) from the same area in 2018-2019:

- **Analyses of contaminant inputs conducted on clams in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut (2017-2018)** (upcoming)

For further information, please consult the following paper: [**Meaghan C. Bartley, Tommy Tremblay, Amila O. De Silva, C. Michelle Kamula, Stephen Ciastek, Zou Zou A. Kuzyk. 2023. Sedimentary records of contaminant inputs in Frobisher Bay, Nunavut. Environmental Science and Ecotechnology, 100313**](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ese.2023.100313).

This project is part of the Coastal Environmental Baseline Program under the Oceans Protection Plan of Fisheries and Oceans Canada.

description_translated.en:
Created in 2005 by federal and provincial government as well as academic institutions and community organizations, the St. Lawrence Global Observatory (SLGO) makes it possible to maximize the benefits of data collection by integrating multidisciplinary data from multiple partners on a single web portal. Promoting data discovery and re-use, SLGO counts 48 members and is recognized throughout the world.

The content distributed by SLGO spans across all disciplines, themes and areas of interest that data-producing members choose to make accessible. A large amount of scientific and environmental information is already available through SLGO's portal. Furthermore, in order to maximize data availability, SLGO's team develops user-friendly web applications to facilitate data visualization and download in various formats.

SLGO is, as such, responsible for the activities of the region of the St. Lawrence of CIOOS. To contribute, we invite you to contact us.
